snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York urged candidates to sign a pledge backing his 10-point plan, which would strengthen laws against sexual harassment, domestic violence and salary discrimination.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo, seeking to pressure lawmakers into fulfilling their campaign promises and to mobilize female voters to support his re-election, calls on state legislative candidates to sign pledge endorsing his 10-point Women's Equality Act; legislation would bolster laws against sexual harassment, domestic violence and salary discrimination.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York urged candidates to sign a pledge backing his 10-point plan, which would strengthen laws against sexual harassment, domestic violence and salary discrimination.

headline.main: Cuomo Presses Candidates to Back Women’s Equality Act
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Urges Candidates to Endorse Women’s Act
